text:
Question 110) The phenomenon of pyre (river climb) is an important mechanism that influences the reproduction of some fish species, as it induces the process that stimulates fat burning and active complex hormone mechanisms, preparing them for reproduction. Anthropic interventions in aquatic environments, such as the construction of dams, interfere with the reproduction of these animals.
MALTA, P. Environmental impact of hydroelectric dams. This anthropic intervention harms Piracema because it reduces the
A) Migration path.
B) Longevity of individuals.
C) Food availability.
D) period of migration of the species.
E) number of fish species on site.
